name: Missing collection title
description: A collection (version) should have a title such that humans can refer to it and easier remember it.
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses a title
rationale: A title is needed for humans to refer to the collection, see metric-related requirement
requirements: Collections should use the title property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If no title property is found, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable title
examples: A social media collection (or more general a resource) which misses a dc:title property

name: Number of missing titles
description: Determine the number of collections missing a dublin core title.
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss a title
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections without title
requirements: Collections should use the title property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections without title
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable title
examples: A corpus of social media collections (or more general resources) for which one or more miss a dc:title property

name: Missing collection description
description: A collection (version) should have a description in natural language such that humans can assess the content.
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses a description
rationale: A description is needed for humans to assess the collection, see metric-related requirement
requirements: Collections should use the description property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If no description property is found, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable description
examples: A social media collection (or more general a resource) which misses a dc:description property

name: Number of missing descriptions
description: Determine the number of collections missing a dublin core description.
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss a description
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections without description
requirements: Collections should use the description property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections without description
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable description
examples: A corpus of social media collections (or more general resources) which all one or more miss a dc:description property

name: Insufficient collection description
description: A collection (version) should have a description of at least 200 characters to avoid short meaningless phrases.
measuring: It is measured if a collection has a description with insufficient length
rationale: A description is often more useful with sufficient length as otherwise the description is less descriptive
requirements: Collections should use the description property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a description with less than 200 characters is found, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable description
examples: A social media collection (or more general a resource) which has a dc:description property with a length smaller than 200

name: Number of insufficient descriptions
description: Determine the number of collections with a description which is too short to be considered meaningful.
measuring: It is measured how many collections have an insufficient length
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with insufficient descriptions
requirements: Collections should use the description property which is validated by the shape related to this metric
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with insufficient length
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources profit from having a human readable description
examples: A corpus of social media collections (or more general resources) for which one or more have a dc:description property with a  length smaller than 200

name: Missing collection posts per month
description: The number of social media posts per month should be indicated for a collection.
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses stats about its posts per month
rationale: Statistics of posts per month provide a brief overview, see metric-related requirement
requirements: Aggregated information about posts per month of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain the number of posts for valid months and years, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with a dimension for year and month and an observed number of posts. Either less than two such observations exist or the observations year, month or observed number have invalid datatypes.

name: Number of collections with incomplete monthly temporal coverage
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) with incomplete temporal coverage, i.e. posts not indicated per month.
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss stats about their posts per month
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing posts per month stats
requirements: Aggregated information about posts per month of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with incorrect or missing posts per month information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about posts per month

name: Missing collection content start and end date
description: A collection (version) shows date of the first and date of the last content item
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses stats about the date of its first post and the date of its last post
rationale: The date of the first and the date of the last post provide information about the scope of the collection
requirements: A collection needs to link to its posts and posts need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about the date of its first or the date of its last post, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with an observed date of the first post and another observation with an observed date of the last post. Either one of the observations is missing or has an invalid date

name: Number of missing start and end dates content
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing content start and end date
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss stats about the date of their first post and the date of their last post
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing info about the dates of the first and last post
requirements: A collection needs to link to its posts and posts need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing first and last post date
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about the dates of the first and last post

name: Missing collection harvest start and end date
description: A collection (version) shows date of the first and date of the last harvest
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses stats about the date of its first harvest and the date of its last harvest
rationale: The date of the first and the date of the last harvest provide provenance of the collections’ creation
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about the dates of its first and last harvest, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with an observed date of the first harvest and another observation with an observed date of the last harvest. Either one of the observations is missing or has an invalid date

name: Number of missing start and end dates harvest
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing harvest start and end date
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss stats about the date of their first harvest and the date of their last harvest
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing info about the first and last harvest provenance
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing first and last harvest date
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about the dates of the first and last harvest

name: Missing collection harvest info
description: A collection shows when its harvests where executed
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about its harvests
rationale: Information about harvests, such as their data, provide valuable provenance information of collections
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about its harvests, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection which does not link to a WARC file created by a harvest

name: Number of missing collection harvests
description: Determine the number of collections not showing when its harvests were executed
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about their harvests
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing harvest provenance
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing harvest information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more do not link to at least one WARC file created by a harvest

name: Missing collection version harvest info
description: A collection version shows when its harvest(s) where executed
measuring: It is measured if a collection version misses information about its harvest(s)
rationale: Information about harvests, such as their data, provide valuable provenance information of collections
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection version does not contain information about its harvest(s), this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection version which does not link to a WARC file created by a harvest

name: Number of missing collection version harvests
description: Determine the number of collection versions not showing when its harvests were executed.
measuring: It is measured how many collection versions miss information about their harvest(s)
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing harvest provenance
requirements: A collection needs to link to its harvests and the harvests need a creation date
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collection versions with missing harvest information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collection versions for which one or more do not link to at least one WARC file created by a harvest

name: Missing collection versions info
description: A collection shows its versions
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about its versions
rationale: Collections metadata or seeds can be changed which influences the content of the collection, thus different versions should be available
requirements: A collection needs to link to its versions
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about its versions, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection which is not linked from versions via prov:specializationOf

name: Number of missing collection versions info
description: Determine the number of collections not showing its versions
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about their versions
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing version information
requirements: A collection needs to link to its versions
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing version information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collection versions for which one or more are not linked from versions via prov:specializationOf

name: Missing collection seeds info
description: A collection (version) shows which seeds versions were used to create it
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about used seeds to create it
rationale: The seeds of collections provide valuable information about the content and should be accessible for users to assess the collection
requirements: A collection (version) needs to link to concrete seeds versions used to create the collection
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about its seeds, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection which does not link to harvests and seeds used by the harvest

name: Number of missing collection seeds
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing which seeds versions were used to create it
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about used seeds to create them
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing seed information
requirements: A collection (version) needs to link to concrete seeds versions used to create the collection
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing seed information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more do not link to harvests and seeds used by the harvest

name: Missing collection named entities info
description: A collection (version) shows the top-10 named entities identified in the collection (version)
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about most used named entities
rationale: A list of most used named entities in a collection provides valuable information to assess a collection
requirements: Aggregated information about most used named entities of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about most used named entities, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with a dimension for a named entity and an observed number of its occurrences within the collection. Either less than a specified number of such observations exist or the observation contains an invalid number

name: Number of missing top 10 named entities
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing top-10 named entities identified in the collection (version).
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about most used named entities
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing most used named entities information
requirements: Aggregated information about most used named entities of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing most used named entities information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about posts

name: Missing collection persons and locations info
description: A collection (version) shows at least the top-10 person and locations named entities
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about most used ‘person’ and ‘location’ named entities
rationale: Many types of named entities exist, persons and locations are common entities which are identified
requirements: Aggregated information about most used person and location entities of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about most used persons and locations, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with a dimension for a named entity (person or location) and an observed number of its occurrences within the collection. Either less than a specified number of such observations exist or the observation contains an invalid number

name: Number of missing collection persons and locations
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing at least the top-10 person and locations named entities
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about most used ‘person’ and ‘location’ named entities
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing information about identified persons and locations
requirements: Aggregated information about most used person and location entities of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing person and location named entities information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about posts

name: Missing collection hashtags info
description: A collection (version) shows the top-10 hashtags identified in the collection (version)
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about most used hashtags
rationale: A list of most used hashtags in a collection provides valuable information to assess a collection
requirements: Aggregated information about most used hashtags of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about its most used hashtags, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection referred via a dimension from a data cube observation, together with a dimension for a hashtag and an observed number of its occurrences within the collection. Either less than a specified number of such observations exist or the observation contains an invalid number

name: Number of missing collection hashtags
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing top-10 hashtags identified in the collection (version)
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about most used hashtags
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing most used hashtags information
requirements: Aggregated information about most used hashtags of a collection should be available, e.g. as data cube observations
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing most used hashtags information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more miss data cube observations or have invalid observations about posts

name: Mmissing collection license info
description: A collection (version) shows its license for reuse
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses licensing information
rationale: Licensing information provides users information about how collections might be reused
requirements: A collection needs to link to its license
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about its license, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A social media collection which does not link to license information

name: Number of missing collection license
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing their license for reuse
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss licensing information
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing licensing information
requirements: A collection needs to link to its license
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing license information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions)
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more do not link to license information

name: Missing collection formats info
description: A collection (version) shows its available formats
measuring: It is measured if a collection misses information about available metadata formats of the collection
rationale: Users of different domains with different software may need information about a collection in different metadata formats
requirements: A collection should have a property indicating in which metadata formats it is available
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with 'single-collection-assessment.sparql'
validation: If a collection does not contain information about available metadata formats, this metric is true
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources (datsets) profit from information about available formats
examples: A social media collection which does not link to available metadata formats

name: Number of missing collection formats
description: Determine the number of collection (versions) not showing their available formats
measuring: It is measured how many collections miss information about available metadata formats of them
rationale: For quality assessment it is important to identify collections with missing information about available metadata formats
requirements: A collection should have a property indicating in which metadata formats it is available
procedure: The related shapes are validated and the resulting SHACL validation report is queried with `collection-assessment.sparql`
validation: This metric should be a positive integer representing the number of collections with missing available metadata formats information
relevance: This metric applies on social media collections (versions), however all resources (datsets) profit from information about available formats
examples: A corpus of social media collections for which one or more do not link to available metadata formats
